results.title: Dancers of the sea
results.creator_credit: Les Documents Cinematographiques, Jean Painleve and Genevieve Hamon
results.brief_description: Made by Painleve, famous French scientific documentary filmmaker, this film is a close study of a number of types of starfish. It deals with eating methods, breeding habits, movement on the ocean floor and in the water of some beautiful sea creatures. The film uses high speed and microcinematography to great advantage in this study of marine life.

results.title: Dancers
results.creator_credit: Golan-Globus, Hera Productions, Baryshnikov Productions, Menahem Golan, Yoram Globus and Herbert Ross
results.brief_description: Mikhail Baryshnikov, one of the world’s greatest and most admired ballet dancers stars in this romantic drama about an American ballet company’s arrival in Italy to perform the romantic ballet ‘Giselle’. Baryshnikov plays Tony (Anton) Sergeyev, lead dancer and director of the production, ladies’ man, experienced and charming who finds himself attracted to the newest member of his troupe, the young and naive American teenager Lisa (Julie Kent). Art begins to mirror life as the drama of love and betrayal of ‘Giselle’ is played out backstage between Tony and Lisa. Features the dancers of the American Ballet Theater, Allesandra Ferri (Francesca), Leslie Browne (Nadine) and Mariangela Melato (the Contessa). ‘Giselle’ is conducted by Michael Tilson Thomas and performed by the London Symphony Orchestra, original music by Pino Donaggio.

results.title: Dancehall queen [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Island Jamaica Films, Hawk's Nest Productions, Carolyn Pfeiffer, Carl Bradshaw, Don Letts and Rick Elgood
results.brief_description: Filmed on location in Kingston, Jamaica, “Dancehall Queen”s’ plot centres on the travails of Marcia, a struggling single mother who works as a street vendor to support her two daughters. Threatened by a benefactor who demands sexual favours from her teenage daughter, and a thug intent on destroying her vending business, she enters a dance hall contest and regains control of her life. The highlight of the film is the depiction of Jamaica’s vibrant dancehall culture. The dancehall, which historically provided a vital space for the development of reggae music, continues to be one of Jamaica’s most energized environments, bubbling with a creativity expressed through outrageous fashions, defiant sexual expression, innovative dance steps, a distinct vernacular and, of course, its ever evolving music. Dancehall music is the present day form of Jamaican reggae, voicing the young (and the not so young) population’s concerns, conflicts, fantasies and frustrations, while offering escapist, humorous observations of oppressive situations. While dancehall music is dominated by men, the dancing is ruled by women who compete with each other to come up with the most risque costumes—characterised by excessive amounts of jewelry, pastel-colored wigs and thigh-high patent leather boots—and the most sexually provocative dance moves. Though the Jamaican Patois English is sometimes hard to decipher, “Dancehall Queen” offers a vibrant portrayal of contemporary Jamaica. Includes music from Beenie Man, Chevelle Franklyn, Bounty Killer, The Marley Girls and Grace Jones.

results.title: Dance with teletubbies
results.creator_credit: BBC, Ragdoll Productions, Anne Wood, Andrew Davenport, Vic Finch and David G. Hillier
results.brief_description: Teletubbies is a TV show that originated on the BBC and has proven to be especially popular among younger children. Tinky Winky, Dipsy, Laa-Laa and Po live in a magical land over the hills and far away, where television comes from - a land where anything can happen. Come and dance with the Teletubbies as they discover how to move their bodies to music!

results.title: Dance trip
results.brief_description: Describes the immigration of Filipinos to Hawaii and their lives, history and accomplishments there; recounts Philippine-United States relationships through old film clips. Presents many Filipino folk dances as danced by the Bailes de Jose.

results.title: Dance squared = Ronde carree
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Frank Spiller and Rene Jodoin
results.brief_description: This film is an encounter with geometrical shapes which children can readily understand and enjoy. As the title suggests “Dance Squared” employs movement, colour and music to explore the symmetries of the square. Every movement of the square and its components presents an opportunity to observe its geometrical properties in a way that is intriguing to young minds. With basic concepts firmly grasped, the young student is then prepared to experiment on his own. No dialogue, set to square dance music, suitable for all ages. (Five awards, including Chicago and Toronto.)

results.title: Dance on a May Day
results.creator_credit: Learning Corporation of America and John G. Avildsen
results.brief_description: Focuses on professional dancer Jacques d’Amboise, who founded the National Dance Institute for the purpose of introducing dance to boys. Observes d’Amboise and his students in practice sessions, as well as in performance at New York’s Lincoln Center.

results.title: Dance of the wind = Wara Mandel
results.creator_credit: Pandora Filmproduktion, Elephant Eye, Illuminations Films, JBA, Karl Baumgartner and Rajan Khosa
results.brief_description: Pallavi is the daughter of a renowned Indian singer who is continuing in her mother’s footsteps as a classical singer, concert performer and teacher. After the death of her mother, she is saddened and loses her confidence and ability to perform. She develops a friendship with an elusive street urchin with a beautiful singing voice, and embarks on a journey of self-discovery and healing. An award winning film by Rajan Khosa which captures the beauty of Indian classical music. Cast includes Kitu Gidwani, Bhaveen Gosain and B.C. Sanyal. In Hindi and English with English subtitles.

results.title: Dance of the shells = Tanz der muscheln
results.brief_description: The many shaped and many textured world of shells from all over the oceans is observed under changing lights and in varied patterns of movement. The accompanying music is composed of electronically produced sound. Beautifully photographed and dramatically lit - a very striking film.
